name: How Wolves Change Rivers
title: How Wolves Change Rivers
text: Use with younger students to inspire discussion around change-making cascades. Explore trophic cascades to reinforce comp and/or persuasive (change-maker) writing.
description: When wolves were reintroduced to Yellowstone National Park in the United States after being absent nearly 70 years, the most remarkable 'trophic cascade'...

name: Wolves of Yellowstone
text: How to tell a story: Combine with How Wolves Change Rivers to explore how small changes can impact readers / viewers. Reinforces cascade for comp kids.
title: Wolves of Yellowstone
description: Gray wolves were reintroduced into Yellowstone National Park in 1995, which have since resulted in a trophic cascade through the entire ecosystem. After the ...

name: Wolves in Yellowstone Student Worksheet
text: Middle school expansion worksheets reinforce concepts of trophic cascades for comprehension students
title: Wolves in Yellowstone Student Worksheet (2 of 2)
description: Gray wolves were reintroduced into Yellowstone National Park in 1995, which have since resulted in a trophic cascade through the entire ecosystem.

name: Multiplying fractions - cheesy rap video
text: Cheesy rap may appeal to goofy and/or rhymically-inclined students
title: Multiplying Fractions Song | Math Rap Video
description: Explore our ever-growing library of math videos and highly engaging related activities at https://www.numberock.com.Thank you for watching our Multiplying Fractions...

name: Multiplying 2 fractions: fraction model

title: Multiplying 2 fractions: Fraction model
description: Here's a great way to visualize fraction multiplication problems. Once you understand this, doing them on your own will be a lot easier!Practice this lesson ...

name: Author's Purpose is to Persuade
text: Friendly, accessible template for K-3 persuasive writing
title: The Author's Purpose is to Persuade

name: Persuasive Template
text: Bright, cartoonish. Defines 'persuade' in simple langauge
title: Persuasive Template

name: Call to action
text: Middle School extension: Call to Action Writing
title: Tips and Tricks for Writing a Perfect Call to Action
description: Different ways you can start a narrative for Creative Writing.

name: Writing a Hook
text: Entertaining, particularly for reluctant writers in 4th, 5th, 6th grades
title: Writing a Hook
description: The trick to a good Call to Action is making the audience feel motivated to act in a certain way. Learn how to write one in any genre.

name: Superconducting Magnetic Levitation
text: Part of Weird Science series for writing and comp students. Typically, grades 4 and up.

name: WIRED: How the Most Promising Hoverboards Actually Work
text: Intro activity to engage mechanically-minded reluctant readers and writers. Visualizing and tell-backs are critical.
title: 'How the Most Promising Hoverboards Actually Work | WIRED
description: Everyone wants a hoverboard. Here are three real hoverboards that exist right now.
